ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Mit-latitude Geomagnetic Indices ASY and SYM
ResourceHeader.Description: The mit-latitude geomagnetic indices at 1-min time resolution, derived at World Data Center for Geomagnetism, Kyoto, Kyoto University.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: If the data are used in publications and presentations, the data suppliers and the WDC for Geomagnetism, Kyoto must properly be acknowledged.

InformationURL.Name: Geomagnetic Auroral Electrojet index Home Page
InformationURL.Description: The web site with links to pages describing the internationally accepted standard technique for generating the AE Index and for access to the index data in WDC format.

AccessURL.Name: Geomagnetic Data Service
AccessURL.Description: Geomagnetic Data Service at World Data Center for Geomagnetism, Kyoto.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: If the data are used in publications and presentations, the data suppliers and the WDC for Geomagnetism, Kyoto must properly be acknowledged.

Parameter.Name: Universal Time
Parameter.Description: Time is expressed with year, month, day, hour, and min, each stored in integer format. Details of the data record format is described at http://wdc.kugi.kyoto-u.ac.jp/aeasy/format/asyformat.html

Parameter.Name: Mid-latitude Geomagnetic Index ASY H component
Parameter.Description: The ASY H component is expressed in integer format. Details of the data record format is described at http://wdc.kugi.kyoto-u.ac.jp/aeasy/format/asyformat.html

Parameter.Name: Mid-latitude Geomagnetic Index ASY D component
Parameter.Description: The ASY D component is expressed in integer format. Details of the data record format is described at http://wdc.kugi.kyoto-u.ac.jp/aeasy/format/asyformat.html

Parameter.Name: Mid-latitude Geomagnetic Index SYM H component
Parameter.Description: The SYM H component is expressed in integer format. Details of the data record format is described at http://wdc.kugi.kyoto-u.ac.jp/aeasy/format/asyformat.html

Parameter.Name: Mid-latitude Geomagnetic Index SYM D component
Parameter.Description: The SYM D component is expressed in integer format. Details of the data record format is described at http://wdc.kugi.kyoto-u.ac.jp/aeasy/format/asyformat.html
